info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 01 at 3:58PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of far east central Polk and west central Marion Counties through 445 PM PDT... At 356 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Eola, or near Salem, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rain, wind gusts to 35 mph, and penny size hail. In addition, this storm has the potential to produce brief funnel clouds. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Salem, Brooks, Hayesville, Keizer, and Gervais. This includes the following highways in Oregon... Interstate 5 between mile markers 251 and 266. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
